com.samysadi.acs.hardware.storage.operation

Class StorageOperationDefault

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.samysadi.acs.core.notifications.NotifierImpl
      • com.samysadi.acs.core.tracing.ProbedImpl
        • com.samysadi.acs.core.entity.EntityImpl
          • com.samysadi.acs.core.entity.RunnableEntityImpl
            • com.samysadi.acs.virtualization.job.operation.OperationImpl<Resource>
              • com.samysadi.acs.virtualization.job.operation.LongOperationImpl<StorageResource>
                • com.samysadi.acs.hardware.storage.operation.StorageOperationDefault
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Entity, RunnableEntity, Notifier, Probed, StorageOperation, Operation<StorageResource>, SynchronizableOperation<StorageResource>, Cloneable

    public class StorageOperationDefault
extends LongOperationImpl<StorageResource>
implements StorageOperation, SynchronizableOperation<StorageResource>
    This implementations uses, when its StorageFile is located in a remote host, a OperationSynchronizer in order to synchronize this storage operation with the network operation.
    When a remote job is needed, it is created under a new VM or, if the remote host is a ThinClient, using its main vm.
    Since:
    1.0
    Author:
    Samy Sadi , Belabbas Yagoubi

    • Constructor Detail

      • StorageOperationDefault

        public StorageOperationDefault()
        Empty constructor that creates a zero-length operation with a null storage file.

        This constructor is provided only to satisfy the Entity contract.
        You should use StorageOperationDefault(StorageFile, com.samysadi.acs.hardware.storage.operation.StorageOperation.StorageOperationType, long, long) though.

      • StorageOperationDefault

        public StorageOperationDefault(StorageFile file,
                       StorageOperation.StorageOperationType type,
                       long filePos,
                       long size)
        Creates a read, write or append operation on the given file.

        If the type of the operation is APPEND, then filePos is always assumed to be equal to the size of the given file. In other words, you can only append data to the end of the file. Also, a total of size is appended to the given file after the operation ends.

        If the type of the operation is READ or WRITE, then you must ensure that filePos and the the file's size demarcates a valid file zone (ie: a zone inside the bounds of the given file).
        More formally, the given filePos must be greater than or equal to 0 and lesser than or equal to the given file's size.
        Also, if filePos+size>file.getSize() then an IllegalArgumentException exception is thrown (ie: you cannot read or write outside the file's bounds).

        Parameters:
        file -
        type -
        filePos -
        size -
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if file is null
        IllegalArgumentException - if filePos and/or size are invalid

        A NotificationCodes.SO_SF_CHANGED is also thrown.

      • canRestart

        public boolean canRestart()
        Description copied from interface: RunnableEntity
        Returns true if this entity can be restarted safely, and calling RunnableEntity.doRestart() on this entity will not throw an exception.

        Usually, this methods returns true, if these next conditions are verified:

        • RunnableEntity.isRunning() returns false;
        • Calling Entity.hasParentRec() on this entity returns true;
        • If the parent of this entity is a RunnableEntity, then it must be running;
        • Other implementation-specific conditions may also apply.
        Specified by:
        canRestart in interface RunnableEntity
        Overrides:
        canRestart in class RunnableEntityImpl
        Returns:
        true if this entity can be restarted safely

      • canStart

        public boolean canStart()
        Description copied from interface: RunnableEntity
        Returns true if this entity can be started safely, and calling RunnableEntity.doStart() on this entity will not throw an exception.

        This methods returns true, if these next conditions are verified:

        • RunnableEntity.isTerminated() returns false;
        • RunnableEntity.isRunning() returns false;
        • Calling Entity.hasParentRec() on this entity returns true;
        • If the parent of this entity is a RunnableEntity, then it must be running;
        • Other implementation-specific conditions may also apply.
        Specified by:
        canStart in interface RunnableEntity
        Overrides:
        canStart in class RunnableEntityImpl
        Returns:
        true if this entity can be started safely

      • startSynchronization

        public void startSynchronization(long delay,
                        Operation<?> operation)
        Description copied from interface: SynchronizableOperation
        Call this method so that the current operation will adjust its allocated resource in order to finish (ie: to be completed) after running for at least the given delay.

        Calling this method will guarantee that this operation needs to be running for at least the given delay before it becomes completed.
        But this method does not guarantee that the operation will be completed after it has been running for exactly the given delay, in the case where it gets a too low resource promise from its provisioner. It may still need extra running time to be completed.

        If synchronization was already started using this method, then this method should behave as if it was called after calling SynchronizableOperation.stopSynchronization().

        Specified by:
        startSynchronization in interface SynchronizableOperation<StorageResource>
        Parameters:
        delay - minimum remaining delay for this operation
        operation - contains the operation which the current operation is synchronized with, if any

      • stopSynchronization

        public void stopSynchronization()
        Description copied from interface: SynchronizableOperation
        Call this method to clear any synchronization restrictions that were set using SynchronizableOperation.startSynchronization(long, Operation).

        If the operation is not synchronized, then nothing is done.

        Specified by:
        stopSynchronization in interface SynchronizableOperation<StorageResource>

      • isSynchronized

        public boolean isSynchronized(Operation<?> operation)
        Description copied from interface: SynchronizableOperation
        Return true if current operation is synchronized with the given operation.

        In other words, this method returns true if this operation is synchronized using SynchronizableOperation.startSynchronization(long, Operation), AND the operation which it is synchronized with is the same as the given operation. false is returned if the given operation was not synchronized at all, or if SynchronizableOperation.stopSynchronization() was used.

        Specified by:
        isSynchronized in interface SynchronizableOperation<StorageResource>
        Returns:
        true if current operation is synchronized with the given operation
